00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32.h"
00030 #include "ht32_board.h"
00031 
00032 /** @addtogroup HT32_Series_Peripheral_Examples HT32 Peripheral Examples
00033   * @{
00034   */
00035

00043

00045 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 void EnableSecurity(void);
00047 
00048 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00049 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00050   * @brief  Main program.
00051   * @retval None
00052   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00053 int main(void)
00054 {
00055   vu32 i;
00056 
00057   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00058      The Option Byte will be write protected (cannot be changed again) after the
00059      Security Protection is enabled. Refer to the user manual for details.
00060   */
00061   EnableSecurity();
00062 
00063   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED1);
00064 
00065   while (1)
00066   {
00067     for (i = 0; i < 10000000; i++);
00068     HT32F_DVB_LEDToggle(HT_LED1);
00069   }
00070 }
00071 
00072 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00073   * @brief  Check and eanble security protection.
00074   * @retval None
00075   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00076 void EnableSecurity(void)
00077 {
00078   FLASH_OptionByte Option;
00079 
00080   /* Get Option Byte status                                                                                 */
00081   FLASH_GetOptionByteStatus(&Option);
00082 
00083   if (Option.MainSecurity == 0)
00084   {
00085     /* Before Option Byte programming, the erase operation should be performed                              */
00086     FLASH_EraseOptionByte();
00087 
00088     /* Enable Security protection                                                                           */
00089     Option.MainSecurity  = 1;
00090     FLASH_ProgramOptionByte(&Option);
00091 
00092     /* After system reset, the Option Byte value could be reloaded                                          */
00093     NVIC_SystemReset();
00094   }
00095 }
00096 
00097 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
00098 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00099   * @brief  Report both the error name of the source file and the source line number.
00100   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
00101   * @param  uline: error line source number.
00102   * @retval None
00103   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00104 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
00105 {
00106   /*
00107      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00108      Debug message can be added here.
00109      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00110   */
00111 
00112   while (1)
00113   {
00114   }
00115 }
00116 #endif
